name: The Wilma
description: The Wilma, also known as Wilma Theatre, is a historic cinema and events venue in Missoula, Montana, United States. Built in 1921 by William 'Billy' Simons and dedicated to his wife, Edna Wilma, a light opera artist, the venue was designed by Norwegian architect Ole Bakke. It features Sullivanesque architecture and was the first steel-framed high-rise building in Missoula. The venue includes a main 1400-seat hall, a lounge, three banquet rooms, a restaurant, apartments, and offices. The interior is adorned with Louis XIV Style gilt trim. In 2015, The Wilma was acquired by Missoula-based owners and underwent a major renovation to restore its historical aspects while updating production and customer services. It is now operated by Logjam Presents, which is committed to providing a superior live entertainment experience. The venue hosts a variety of events including independent movies, spoken word events, stand-up comedy, live and local music, plays, and other events.
